15.heading: Art.
15.title: Dancing with Your Eyes Closed
15.author: Joe Zabel, Gary Dumm ; introduction by Harvey Pekar.
notes: Summary: "Steve Morton is a morose loner who embarks on an odyssey of the heart, staking his hopes on a new age dance group that promises to be something more. Eyes closed, he navigates the rocky shores of art, religion and sexuality, and discovers within himself a wellspring of vivid inspiration. But with his eyes open, he recognizes the truth about the people with whom he dances."

53.heading: Art and Comics.
53.title: "Un Matin d'Équinoxe sur la Ligne de l'Équateur : Réponse à Fabrice Bousteau"
53.author: André-Marc Delocque-Fourcaud
53.appears_in: p. 6-7 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: English summary (from p. 150): "Reply to Fabrice Bousteau. One year ago, Fabrice Bousteau, chief editor of the monthly Beaux-Arts Magazine, introduced a dossier on comics explaining that comics were obviously not art. André-Marc Delocque-Fourcaud, the director of our journal, replies and comments on the fact that some scholars will never understand what comics are really about."

Includes a program of events, and photographs of Dean Haspiel, Renee French, Brian Ralph, Mark Nevins, Gene Kannenberg, Kim Deitch, Bill Griffith, Charles Hatfield, Joseph Witek, Will Eisner, Jeff Smith, Jason Little, and Craig Thompson.
